meanings.definition: (Latin) to rush in, burst in, invade.
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to rush in, burst in, invade.

examples.translation: The enemies rushed into the camp.

etymology.value: From in- (into) + ruere (to rush, fall violently).

verb_forms.present_indicative: irruo, irruis, irruit, irruimus, irruitis, irruunt
verb_forms.imperfect_indicative: irruebam, irruebas, irruebat, irruebamus, irruebatis, irruebant
verb_forms.future_indicative: irruam, irrues, irruet, irruemus, irruetis, irruent
verb_forms.perfect_indicative: irrui, irruisti, irruit, irruimus, irruistis, irruerunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_indicative: irrueram, irrueras, irruerat, irrueramus, irrueratis, irruerant
verb_forms.future_perfect_indicative: irruero, irrueris, irruerit, irruerimus, irrueritis, irruerint
verb_forms.present_subjunctive: irruam, irruas, irruat, irruamus, irruatis, irruant
verb_forms.imperfect_subjunctive: irruerem, irrueres, irrueret, irrueremus, irrueretis, irruerent
verb_forms.perfect_subjunctive: irruerim, irrueris, irruerit, irruerimus, irrueritis, irruerint
verb_forms.pluperfect_subjunctive: irruissem, irruisses, irruisset, irruissemus, irruissetis, irruissent

usage_notes.explanation: Irruere is a Latin verb primarily used to describe a forceful entry or invasion. It often implies a sudden and violent action.
